required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: GLORIA-AF Registry Program (Phase II/III - EU/EEA Member States)
clinical_study.official_title: GLORIA - AF: Global Registry on Long-Term Oral Anti-thrombotic TReatment In PAtients With Atrial Fibrillation (Phase II/III - EU/EEA Member States)

brief_summary.textblock: In this part of the Registry Program patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation (AF) at risk for stroke are enrolled to characterize the target population and to collect real world data on important outcome events. For administrative purposes the study is divided into two protocol numbers: 1160.129 for non-EU (European Union) and non-EEA (European Economic Area) countries, and 1160.136 for EU and EEA countries. The total number of patients enrolled in both protocols is estimated to be 48,000 patients, and all these patients will be included in the data analysis for study 1160.129.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence Rate of Composite Outcome (Stroke, Systemic Embolism, Myocardial Infarction, Life-threatening Bleeding Events and Vascular Death)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.
primary_outcome.description: Incidence rate of composite outcome which includes events of Stroke, systemic embolism, myocardial infarction, life-threatening bleeding events and vascular death on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only. In case of multiple events for a patient, the first event was considered. Unknown death was imputed by multiple imputation. The average of the 20 incidence rates from the 20 imputed datasets were used to obtain the point estimate of the incidence rate that is reported here. The bootstrapping approach was used to obtain the 95% confidence interval of the incidence rate.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence Rate of Vascular Composite Outcome (Stroke, Systemic Embolism, Myocardial Infarction and Vascular Death)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.
primary_outcome.description: Incidence rate of vascular composite outcome including events of stroke, systemic embolism, myocardial infarction and vascular death on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only. In case of multiple events for a patient, the first event was considered. Unknown death was imputed by multiple imputation. The average of the 20 incidence rates from the 20 imputed datasets were used to obtain the point estimate of the incidence rate that is reported here. The bootstrapping approach was used to obtain the 95% confidence interval of the incidence rate.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence Rate of Stroke or Systemic Embolism
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.
primary_outcome.description: Incidence rate of stroke or systemic embolism on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.
primary_outcome.description: Incidence rate of stroke on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only. Stroke is an acute onset of a focal neurological deficit of presumed vascular origin lasting for 24 hours or more or resulting in death. The stroke included ischemic or hemorrhagic or uncertain classification.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence Rate of Transient Ischaemic Attack (TIA)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.
primary_outcome.description: Incidence rate of transient ischaemic attack (TIA) on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.
primary_outcome.description: Incidence rate of systemic embolism (SEE) on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.
primary_outcome.description: Incidence rate of pulmonary embolism (PE) on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence Rate of Major Bleeding Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.
primary_outcome.description: Incidence rate of major bleeding events on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only. Major bleeding was defined as meeting one or more of the following criteria: Overt bleeding associated with a reduction in haemoglobin of at least 20 grams per liter or leading to a transfusion of at least 2 units of blood or packed cells; Symptomatic bleeding in a critical area or organ: Intraocular, intracranial, intraspinal or intramuscular with compartment syndrome, retroperitoneal bleeding, intra-articular bleeding or pericardial bleeding; Life-threatening bleeding.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence Rate of Life-threatening Bleeding Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.
primary_outcome.description: Incidence rate of life-threatening bleeding events on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only. Life-threatening bleeding was defined as meeting one or more of the following criteria: Symptomatic intracranial bleed; Reduction in haemoglobin of at least 50 grams per liter; Transfusion of at least 4 units of blood or packed cells, associated with hypotension requiring the use of intravenous inotropic agents; Necessitated surgical intervention; Fatal bleeding.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.
primary_outcome.description: Incidence rate of vascular death on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.
primary_outcome.description: Incidence rate of myocardial infarction on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.
primary_outcome.description: Incidence rate of all-cause death on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study investigated characteristics of patients with non-valvular atrial fibrillation influencing the choice of antithrombotic treatment for the prevention of stroke, and the safety and effectiveness of dabigatran versus Vitamin K Antagonist for up to 3-year follow-up period.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All subjects were screened for eligibility prior to participation in the study. Subjects attended a participating site which ensured that they (the subjects) strictly met all inclusion and none of the exclusion criteria.

group.title: Dabigatran Etexilate - Baseline
group.description: Patients who were prescribed Dabigatran etexilate at baseline were included in this group. Patients can take other Antithrombotic treatments later during the study. Patients who were newly diagnosed non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (AF) less than 3 months before the baseline visits (less than 4.5 months before baseline visit for Latin America) and who were at risk for stroke in a real-life setting. Antithrombotic treatments were used according to local practice for stroke prevention. The choice of antithrombotic agent and dosing was at the discretion of the treating physician.

group.title: Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) - Baseline
group.description: Patients who were prescribed Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) at baseline were included in this group. Patients can take other Antithrombotic treatments later during the study. Patients who were newly diagnosed non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (AF) less than 3 months before the baseline visits (less than 4.5 months before baseline visit for Latin America) and who were at risk for stroke in a real-life setting. Antithrombotic treatments were used according to local practice for stroke prevention. The choice of antithrombotic agent and dosing was at the discretion of the treating physician.

group.title: Rivaroxaban - Baseline
group.description: Patients who were prescribed Rivaroxaban at baseline were included in this group. Patients can take other Antithrombotic treatments later during the study. Patients who were newly diagnosed non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (AF) less than 3 months before the baseline visits (less than 4.5 months before baseline visit for Latin America) and who were at risk for stroke in a real-life setting. Antithrombotic treatments were used according to local practice for stroke prevention. The choice of antithrombotic agent and dosing was at the discretion of the treating physician.

group.description: Patients who were prescribed Apixaban at baseline were included in this group. Patients can take other Antithrombotic treatments later during the study. Patients who were newly diagnosed non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (AF) less than 3 months before the baseline visits (less than 4.5 months before baseline visit for Latin America) and who were at risk for stroke in a real-life setting. Antithrombotic treatments were used according to local practice for stroke prevention. The choice of antithrombotic agent and dosing was at the discretion of the treating physician.

group.description: Patients who were prescribed Edoxaban at baseline were included in this group. Patients can take other Antithrombotic treatments later during the study. Patients who were newly diagnosed non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (AF) less than 3 months before the baseline visits (less than 4.5 months before baseline visit for Latin America) and who were at risk for stroke in a real-life setting. Antithrombotic treatments were used according to local practice for stroke prevention. The choice of antithrombotic agent and dosing was at the discretion of the treating physician.

group.title: Acetylsalicylic Acid (ASA) - Baseline
group.description: Patients who were prescribed Acetylsalicylic acid (ASA) at baseline were included in this group. Patients can take other Antithrombotic treatments later during the study. Patients who were newly diagnosed non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (AF) less than 3 months before the baseline visits (less than 4.5 months before baseline visit for Latin America) and who were at risk for stroke in a real-life setting. Antithrombotic treatments were used according to local practice for stroke prevention. The choice of antithrombotic agent and dosing was at the discretion of the treating physician.

group.title: Antiplts Other Than ASA - Baseline
group.description: Patients who were prescribed Antiplts other than Acetylsalicylic acid (ASA) at baseline were included in this group. Patients can take other Antithrombotic treatments later during the study. Patients who were newly diagnosed non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (AF) less than 3 months before the baseline visits (less than 4.5 months before baseline visit for Latin America) and who were at risk for stroke in a real-life setting. Antithrombotic treatments were used according to local practice for stroke prevention. The choice of antithrombotic agent and dosing was at the discretion of the treating physician.

group.title: No Treatment - Baseline
group.description: Patients who were prescribed no treatment at baseline were included in this group. Patients can take other Antithrombotic treatments later during the study. Patients who were newly diagnosed non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (AF) less than 3 months before the baseline visits (less than 4.5 months before baseline visit for Latin America) and who were at risk for stroke in a real-life setting. Antithrombotic treatments were used according to local practice for stroke prevention. The choice of antithrombotic agent and dosing was at the discretion of the treating physician.

group.title: Combinations With Oral Anticoagulants - Baseline
group.description: Patients who were prescribed the treatments with combinations with oral anticoagulants at baseline were included in this group. This group of patients were not included in the safety analysis as no specific treatment can be defined. Patients who were newly diagnosed non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (AF) less than 3 months before the baseline visits (less than 4.5 months before baseline visit for Latin America) and who were at risk for stroke in a real-life setting. Antithrombotic treatments were used according to local practice for stroke prevention. The choice of antithrombotic agent and dosing was at the discretion of the treating physician.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: No end of study case report form

baseline.population: All eligible: All patients who were enrolled and eligible (i.e. did not have any important. protocol violation(s) and who met certain data cleaning requirements).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Incidence Rate of Composite Outcome (Stroke, Systemic Embolism, Myocardial Infarction, Life-threatening Bleeding Events and Vascular Death)
outcome.description: Incidence rate of composite outcome which includes events of Stroke, systemic embolism, myocardial infarction, life-threatening bleeding events and vascular death on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only. In case of multiple events for a patient, the first event was considered. Unknown death was imputed by multiple imputation. The average of the 20 incidence rates from the 20 imputed datasets were used to obtain the point estimate of the incidence rate that is reported here. The bootstrapping approach was used to obtain the 95% confidence interval of the incidence rate.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.
outcome.population: Restricted patient set: the set consists of all eligible patients who were within the region of propensity score (PS) overlap excluding patients in the non-overlapping tails of the propensity score distribution. The restricted patient set was defined for dabigatran etexilate and vitamin K antagonist patients only.

group.title: Dabigatran Etexilate - Baseline
group.description: Patients who were prescribed Dabigatran etexilate at baseline were included in this group. Patients can take other Antithrombotic treatments later during the study. Patients who were newly diagnosed non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (AF) less than 3 months before the baseline visits (less than 4.5 months before baseline visit for Latin America) and who were at risk for stroke in a real-life setting. Antithrombotic treatments were used according to local practice for stroke prevention. The choice of antithrombotic agent and dosing was at the discretion of the treating physician.

group.title: Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) - Baseline
group.description: Patients who were prescribed Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) at baseline were included in this group. Patients can take other Antithrombotic treatments later during the study. Patients who were newly diagnosed non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (AF) less than 3 months before the baseline visits (less than 4.5 months before baseline visit for Latin America) and who were at risk for stroke in a real-life setting. Antithrombotic treatments were used according to local practice for stroke prevention. The choice of antithrombotic agent and dosing was at the discretion of the treating physician.

measure.title: Incidence Rate of Composite Outcome (Stroke, Systemic Embolism, Myocardial Infarction, Life-threatening Bleeding Events and Vascular Death)
measure.description: Incidence rate of composite outcome which includes events of Stroke, systemic embolism, myocardial infarction, life-threatening bleeding events and vascular death on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only. In case of multiple events for a patient, the first event was considered. Unknown death was imputed by multiple imputation. The average of the 20 incidence rates from the 20 imputed datasets were used to obtain the point estimate of the incidence rate that is reported here. The bootstrapping approach was used to obtain the 95% confidence interval of the incidence rate.
measure.population: Restricted patient set: the set consists of all eligible patients who were within the region of propensity score (PS) overlap excluding patients in the non-overlapping tails of the propensity score distribution. The restricted patient set was defined for dabigatran etexilate and vitamin K antagonist patients only.

analysis.groups_desc: A multivariable Cox regression model was performed including variables of treatment, age, gender, prior bleed, previous stroke/transient ischaemic attack/systemic embolism, previous myocardial infarction, abnormal kidney function and concomitant antiplatelets use.
analysis.estimate_desc: Hazard ratio of dabigatran versus vitamin K antagonist (vitamin K antagonist as reference).

outcome.title: Incidence Rate of Vascular Composite Outcome (Stroke, Systemic Embolism, Myocardial Infarction and Vascular Death)
outcome.description: Incidence rate of vascular composite outcome including events of stroke, systemic embolism, myocardial infarction and vascular death on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only. In case of multiple events for a patient, the first event was considered. Unknown death was imputed by multiple imputation. The average of the 20 incidence rates from the 20 imputed datasets were used to obtain the point estimate of the incidence rate that is reported here. The bootstrapping approach was used to obtain the 95% confidence interval of the incidence rate.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.
outcome.population: Restricted patient set: the set consists of all eligible patients who were within the region of propensity score (PS) overlap excluding patients in the non-overlapping tails of the propensity score distribution. The restricted patient set was defined for dabigatran etexilate and vitamin K antagonist patients only.

group.description: Patients who were prescribed Dabigatran etexilate at baseline were included in this group. Patients can take other Antithrombotic treatments later during the study. analysis.groups_desc: A multivariable Cox regression model was performed including variables of treatment, age, gender, prior bleed, previous stroke/transient ischaemic attack/systemic embolism, previous myocardial infarction, abnormal kidney function and concomitant antiplatelets use.
analysis.estimate_desc: Hazard ratio of dabigatran versus vitamin K antagonist (vitamin K antagonist as reference).

outcome.title: Incidence Rate of Stroke or Systemic Embolism
outcome.description: Incidence rate of stroke or systemic embolism on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.
outcome.population: Restricted patient set: the set consists of all eligible patients who were within the region of propensity score (PS) overlap excluding patients in the non-overlapping tails of the propensity score distribution. The restricted patient set was defined for dabigatran etexilate and vitamin K antagonist patients only.

group.title: Dabigatran Etexilate - Baseline
group.description: Patients who were prescribed Dabigatran etexilate at baseline were included in this group. Patients can take other Antithrombotic treatments later during the study. Patients who were newly diagnosed non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (AF) less than 3 months before the baseline visits (less than 4.5 months before baseline visit for Latin America) and who were at risk for stroke in a real-life setting. Antithrombotic treatments were used according to local practice for stroke prevention. The choice of antithrombotic agent and dosing was at the discretion of the treating physician.

group.title: Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) - Baseline
group.description: Patients who were prescribed Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) at baseline were included in this group. Patients can take other Antithrombotic treatments later during the study. outcome.title: Incidence Rate of Stroke
outcome.description: Incidence rate of stroke on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only. Stroke is an acute onset of a focal neurological deficit of presumed vascular origin lasting for 24 hours or more or resulting in death. The stroke included ischemic or hemorrhagic or uncertain classification.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.

measure.title: Incidence Rate of Pulmonary Embolism (PE)
measure.description: Incidence rate of pulmonary embolism (PE) on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only.
measure.population: Restricted patient set: the set consists of all eligible patients who were within the region of propensity score (PS) overlap excluding patients in the non-overlapping tails of the propensity score distribution. The restricted patient set was defined for dabigatran etexilate and vitamin K antagonist patients only.

outcome.title: Incidence Rate of Major Bleeding Events
outcome.description: Incidence rate of major bleeding events on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only. Major bleeding was defined as meeting one or more of the following criteria: Overt bleeding associated with a reduction in haemoglobin of at least 20 grams per liter or leading to a transfusion of at least 2 units of blood or packed cells; Symptomatic bleeding in a critical area or organ: Intraocular, intracranial, intraspinal or intramuscular with compartment syndrome, retroperitoneal bleeding, intra-articular bleeding or pericardial bleeding; Life-threatening bleeding.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.
outcome.population: Restricted patient set: the set consists of all eligible patients who were within the region of propensity score (PS) overlap excluding patients in the non-overlapping tails of the propensity score distribution. The restricted patient set was defined for dabigatran etexilate and vitamin K antagonist patients only.

group.title: Dabigatran Etexilate - Baseline
group.description: Patients who were prescribed Dabigatran etexilate at baseline were included in this group. Patients can take other Antithrombotic treatments later during the study. Patients who were newly diagnosed non-valvular Atrial Fibrillation (AF) less than 3 months before the baseline visits (less than 4.5 months before baseline visit for Latin America) and who were at risk for stroke in a real-life setting. measure.title: Incidence Rate of Major Bleeding Events
measure.description: Incidence rate of major bleeding events on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only. Major bleeding was defined as meeting one or more of the following criteria: Overt bleeding associated with a reduction in haemoglobin of at least 20 grams per liter or leading to a transfusion of at least 2 units of blood or packed cells; Symptomatic bleeding in a critical area or organ: Intraocular, intracranial, intraspinal or intramuscular with compartment syndrome, retroperitoneal bleeding, intra-articular bleeding or pericardial bleeding; Life-threatening bleeding.
measure.population: Restricted patient set: the set consists of all eligible patients who were within the region of propensity score (PS) overlap excluding patients in the non-overlapping tails of the propensity score distribution. The restricted patient set was defined for dabigatran etexilate and vitamin K antagonist patients only.

analysis.groups_desc: A multivariable Cox regression model was performed including variables of treatment, age, gender, prior bleed, previous myocardial infarction, abnormal kidney function, concomitant antiplatelets use and concomitant use of drugs related to bleeding.
analysis.estimate_desc: Hazard ratio of dabigatran versus vitamin K antagonist (vitamin K antagonist as reference).

outcome.title: Incidence Rate of Life-threatening Bleeding Events
outcome.description: Incidence rate of life-threatening bleeding events on restricted set that included Dabigatran etexilate (DE) and Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) only. Life-threatening bleeding was defined as meeting one or more of the following criteria: Symptomatic intracranial bleed; Reduction in haemoglobin of at least 50 grams per liter; Transfusion of at least 4 units of blood or packed cells, associated with hypotension requiring the use of intravenous inotropic agents; Necessitated surgical intervention; Fatal bleeding.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline visit until end of initial treatment regimen episode (minimum date of permanent stop of DE + 3 days/ VKA+ 6 days, start date of other treatments - 1 day, and date of study completion/discontinuation), up to 3 years.
outcome.population: Restricted patient set: the set consists of all eligible patients who were within the region of propensity score (PS) overlap excluding patients in the non-overlapping tails of the propensity score distribution. The restricted patient set was defined for dabigatran etexilate and vitamin K antagonist patients only.

reported_events.time_frame: From baseline visit until study completion or discontinuation, up to 3 years of follow-up.
reported_events.desc: Enrolled and treated: All patients entered in the electronic data capture system who signed the informed consent and treated with at least once with the study treatments. Patients who were prescribed the combinations of oral anticoagulants at enrollment were excluded as no specific treatment can be defined for this group. For patients from the 'No treatment-initial' group, only their adverse events that happened when receiving certain treatment were reported in the respective treatment group.

group.title: Dabigatran Etexilate - at Least Once During the Study
group.description: All patients received at least once dabigatran etexilate during the study were included in the group. Adverse events which happened when the patients received dabigatran etexilate were reported in this group. Patients can take any Antithrombotic treatments during the study. Adverse events were reported in the treatment group a patient actually received when the adverse events happened. Hence, the treatment groups in the adverse events section are not mutually exclusive.

group.title: Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) - at Least Once During the Study
group.description: All patients received at least once Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) during the study were included in the group. Adverse events which happened when the patients received Vitamin K Antagonist (VKA) were reported in this group. Patients can take any Antithrombotic treatments during the study. Adverse events were reported in the treatment group a patient actually received when the adverse events happened. Hence, the treatment groups in the adverse events section are not mutually exclusive.

group.title: Rivaroxaban - at Least Once During the Study
group.description: All patients received at least once Rivaroxaban during the study were included in the group. Adverse events which happened when the patients received Rivaroxaban were reported in this group. Patients can take any Antithrombotic treatments during the study. Adverse events were reported in the treatment group a patient actually received when the adverse events happened. Hence, the treatment groups in the adverse events section are not mutually exclusive.

group.description: All patients received at least once Apixaban during the study were included in the group. Adverse events which happened when the patients received Apixaban were reported in this group. Patients can take any Antithrombotic treatments during the study. Adverse events were reported in the treatment group a patient actually received when the adverse events happened. Hence, the treatment groups in the adverse events section are not mutually exclusive.

group.description: All patients received at least once Edoxaban during the study were included in the group. Adverse events which happened when the patients received Edoxaban were reported in this group. Patients can take any Antithrombotic treatments during the study. Adverse events were reported in the treatment group a patient actually received when the adverse event happened. Hence, the treatment groups in the adverse events section are not mutually exclusive.

group.title: Acetylsalicylic Acid (ASA) - at Least Once During the Study
group.description: All patients received at least once Acetylsalicylic acid (ASA) during the study were included in the group. Adverse events which happened when the patients received Acetylsalicylic acid (ASA) were reported in this group. Patients can take any Antithrombotic treatments during the study. Adverse events were reported in the treatment group a patient actually received when the adverse events happened. Hence, the treatment groups in the adverse events section are not mutually exclusive.

group.title: Antiplts Other Than ASA - at Least Once During the Study
group.description: All patients received at least once Antiplts other than Acetylsalicylic acid (ASA) during the study were included in the group. Adverse events which happened when the patients received Antiplts other than ASA were reported in this group. Patients can take any Antithrombotic treatments during the study. Adverse events were reported in the treatment group a patient actually received when the adverse events happened. Hence, the treatment groups in the adverse events section are not mutually exclusive.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) acknowledges that investigators have the right to publish the study results. Investigators shall provide BI with a copy of any publication or presentation for review prior to any submission. Such review will be done with regard to proprietary information, information related to patentable inventions, medical, scientific, and statistical accuracy within 60 days. BI may request a delay of the publication in order to protect BI's intellectual property rights.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The data used in this analysis included only patients participating in Phase III of this study. Patients participating in Phase II were reported and analyzed in the 1160.129 phase II report, and were not planned to be reported separately for 1160.136.
